Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Dist. No. 1 Prop #1 -- 6.12 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District Number One Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall School District Number One of the Parish of Assumption, Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of six and twelve hundredths (6.12) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $1,062,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of giving additional support to public elementary and secondary schools in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Dist. No. 1 Prop #2 -- 20.81 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District Number One Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall School District Number One of the Parish of Assumption, Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of twenty and eighty-one hundredths (20.81) mills on all property subject to taxation within said District (an estimated $3,612,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, for the purpose of giving additional aid and support to the public schools of the said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Dist. No. 1 Prop #3 -- 6.97 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District Number One Propositions
Proposition No. 3
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall School District Number One of the Parish of Assumption, Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of six and ninety-seven hundredths (6.97) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $1,210,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of giving additional support to public elementary and secondary schools in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: Bayou Pierre Part North GDD -- $50 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Bayou Pierre Part North Gravity Drainage District Proposition
(Parcel Fee)
Race.FullText: Shall Bayou Pierre Part North Gravity Drainage District of the Parish of Assumption, Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee of fifty dollars ($50) on each lot, sub-divided portion of ground and/or individual tract located in said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024 (an estimated $500.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the fee for an entire year), in the manner set out in Section 2740.16 of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, for the purpose of paying the cost of constructing and maintaining levees, levee drainage, flood protection, hurricane flood protection, and all purposes incidental thereto, including paying compensation for the exercise of permanent or temporary servitudes, and to pay, in whole or in part, debt obligations of said District issued for purposes, and shall the proceeds of the parcel fee be subject to funding into bonds for any of the purposes set forth above including any necessary reserve therefor and paying the costs of issuing such bonds?

Race.SpecificTitle: Pierre Part Settlement GDD -- $75 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Pierre Part Settlement Gravity Drainage District Proposition 
(Parcel Fee)
Race.FullText: Shall Pierre Part Settlement Gravity Drainage District of the Parish of Assumption, Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee of seventy-five dollars ($75) on each lot, sub-divided portion of ground and/or individual tract located in said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024 (an estimated $1,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the fee for an entire year), in the manner set out in Section 2740.16 of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, for the purpose of paying the cost of constructing and maintaining levees, levee drainage, flood protection, hurricane flood protection, and all purposes incidental thereto, including paying compensation for the exercise of permanent or temporary servitudes, and to pay, in whole or in part, debt obligations of said District issued for purposes, and shall the proceeds of the parcel fee be subject to funding into bonds for any of the purposes set forth above including any necessary reserve therefor and paying the costs of issuing such bonds?
